• UP to (5,4) – but that’s our tail and since reversing direction (going backwards into your own body) is forbidden, UP is not allowed.
• DOWN to (5,2) – while free, it doesn’t take us any closer to the nearest apple.
• LEFT to (4,3) – free, but would direct us toward the apple at (1,3), which is a bit further away.
• RIGHT to (6,3) – this move puts us on course toward (7,4) and doesn’t run into any obstacles.

• UP → (6,4)
• DOWN → (6,2)
• LEFT → (5,3) – this cell is occupied by our tail and isn’t allowed since we can’t immediately reverse into our own body.

There are no imminent threats—the enemy snake is far away (at (0,2)) and the board’s edges are not an issue here.

So, the safest and most beneficial move is to head RIGHT.
